titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Howell, Jones, and Suydam families genealogical notes 1977.524
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-06 20:49:13 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Howell, Jones, and Suydam families genealogical notes
did.abstract: Four pages of handwritten genealogical notes concerning members of the Jones, Howell, and Suydam families of Brooklyn and Long Island throughout the period 1900 to 1916.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Howell, Jones, and Suydam families genealogical notes, 1977.524, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Susannah Bassett Book of Common Prayer, circa 1800 (1974.108)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four pages of handwritten genealogical notes concerning members of the Jones, Howell, and Suydam families of Brooklyn and Long Island throughout the period 1900 to 1916. The notes were found in the Book of Common Prayer of Susannah Bassett, though the author of the notes is not known.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
